title: System can be shut down without savefile warnings
OB: When a WSWB session is open with some opened, dirty .txt file, shutting down Windows will cause the loss of the changes in the .txt file.
EB: The system should provide a dialog box with the options 'Do you want to save your file?', Yes, No, Cancel. Selecting Cancel should halt the shutdown.
SR:
1. Start WSWB and create a new project.
2. Create a text file in the project and add a line of text to it. Notice that the text file is marked as a dirty file.
3. Left click on the Windows Start menu, select 'Shut Down...' command to shutdown/reboot the computer.
4. Observe if a warning or question message box is displayed to allow users a chance to save their dirty file.
5. Verify that selecting Cancel halts the shutdown process.
